item.title: NYDIG Predicts $30 Billion Inflow In BTC With Spot Bitcoin ETF Approval
item.dc:creator: Bhushan Akolkar
item.description:
BlackRock’s filing of the spot Bitcoin ETF last month has sparked huge interest in the Bitcoin investment product, which is yet to hit the market subject to SEC approval. In its latest research report, NYDIG explained how the arrival of a spot Bitcoin ETF could be a game changer for Bitcoin investors. While the spot

The post NYDIG Predicts $30 Billion Inflow In BTC With Spot Bitcoin ETF Approval appeared first on CoinGape.

item.description:

item.title: Tesla’s Bitcoin (BTC) Holdings Remained Unchanged for Q2, Now At $184 Million
item.dc:creator: Bhushan Akolkar
item.description:
American electric carmaker Tesla reported its second-quarter numbers on Wednesday, July 19. As it turns out, Tesla’s digital asset holdings remained unchanged during the second quarter, which stands at $184 million as of the current market position. Because of accounting regulations that don’t allow unrealized gains on cryptocurrencies to be recorded, the value of the

item.title: XRP Price Regains Bullish Momentum; Time to Surpass $1?
item.dc:creator: Brian Bollinger
item.description:
After a massive jump on July 13th, the XRP price witnessed a minor correction starting from the $0.937 high. This bearish pullback tumbled the prices 36.7% but found immediate support at the 38.2% Fibonacci retracement level. This FIB level aligned with $0.68 support created a strong demand pressure and replenished the exhausted bullish momentum for

item.title: Breaking: Terra Luna Classic Core Developer L1TF Members Resigned, Community Reacts
item.dc:creator: Varinder Singh
item.description:
Terra Luna Classic core developer Joint L1 Task Force (L1TF) project manager LuncBurnArmy (Steve) and developer Fragwuerdig (Till) have resigned due to threats and doxxing. The community expressed disappointment and outrage due to some community members targeting the L1TF developer team. item.title: Breaking: Société Générale’s Crypto Division FORGE Secures the First French Crypto License
item.dc:creator: Bhushan Akolkar
item.description:
One of France’s largest commercial banks – Société Générale – has managed to secure the first French crypto license for its crypto division FORGE. The latest development shows that SG FORGE obtained the AMF license on Tuesday, July 18. Thus, the crypto division can now offer services like the purchase/sale of digital assets with legal

The post Breaking: Société Générale’s Crypto Division FORGE Secures the First French Crypto License appeared first on CoinGape.
item.content:encoded:
One of France’s largest commercial banks – Société Générale – has managed to secure the first French crypto license for its crypto division FORGE. The latest development shows that SG FORGE obtained the AMF license on Tuesday, July 18. Thus, the crypto division can now offer services like the purchase/sale of digital assets with legal

The post Breaking: Société Générale’s Crypto Division FORGE Secures the First French Crypto License appeared first on CoinGape.
